intro: Ranunculus oxyspermus subsp. damascenus, commonly known as the Damascus buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Mediterranean region. It features bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers with numerous petals, typically blooming in spring. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
